alert.note: Alert for Dolores; Mesa; Montezuma; Montrose; San Miguel (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 29 at 7:33AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...INCREASED RELEASES FROM MCPHEE DAM AND HEAVY RUNOFF FROM SNOWMELT IN SMALLER TRIBUTARIES WILL LEAD TO HIGH FLOWS AND INCREASING RIVER LEVELS ALONG THE DOLORES RIVER BASIN UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... Areas along the Dolores River from McPhee Dam to the confluence with the Colorado River will be impacted by increasing river flows and river levels until further notice. Releases are increasing from McPhee Dam in preparation for elevated inflows due to the melting of this year`s snowpack. As temperatures increase this weekend and into early next week...the melting of this snowpack will accelerate. Runoff along tributaries into the Dolores will bring additional flows to the reservoir releases. These flows` impacts on those living adjacent to these water ways can be expected beginning with low land flooding. In addition...recreational interests should be prepared for the impacts of high flows along the Dolores River. Camping areas and access to the river may become inaccessible or inundated. Please heed local advisories and closures. Stay tuned for additional statements and/or Watches and Warnings as river levels continue to rise.

area.areaDesc: Dolores; Mesa; Montezuma; Montrose; San Miguel
